entry.summary: Surprised at how easy/straightforward the process was to get this blog up and running…
entry.content:
Surprised at how easy/straightforward the process was to get this blog up and running using Publii. Happened to come across their Github repo the other day and decided to give it a shot.

With regard to the current setup, I'm using a Github Pages backend (link to the Github repo) redirected to a custom domain name (thedeep3nd.io) - Publii handles most/all of the boilerplate JS/CSS/HTML code to link the two. I looked into some other options - namely, Jekyll and Octopress - when deciding on a framework for this site, but Publii had a couple things that really appealed to me and eventually won me over:

  • great desktop client for Mac
  • accessible/concise documentation
  • ability to build/preview local changes before deploying (committing) to the Github repo
  • an active and growing open-source community
  • free to use!

I'm sure that it's not the most feature-rich or customizable CMS tool out there, but it seems to have pretty much everything that I want: simplicity, ease of use, and (hopefully) dependability.  

More to come.
